title: Robotics as Legal Realization: The Tort Standard
philosophy: Robotics is not merely kinetic motion; it is the physical discharge of a legal intent. Tort is the framework for clinical accountability in high-entropy physical environments.

erc7827_power.definition: The use of ERC-7827 for Single-Board Computers (SBCs).
erc7827_power.mandate: Bridge REST to RPC to meet traditional developers at the JSON standard. A state secured by $300bil of Ethereum economic security is non-negotiable for heavy robotics.

boolean_criticality.definition: The life-or-death nature of robotic state.
boolean_criticality.mandate: A single boolean (e.g., 'Is_Safe') must be bit-perfect and tamper-proof. High-fidelity ledger versioning prevents state-stalling and unauthorized kinetic overrides.

legal_flexibility.definition: The use of JSON for complex robotic contracts.
legal_flexibility.mandate: JSON provides the evolutionary flexibility required for autonomous legal realizations. Robots must act within the bounds of Tort, making robotics a fundamentally legal field.

conclusion: Kinetic compute requires a legislative substrate. Secure the state, scuttle the liability.
